main event: On November 6, 1957 in Lake Worth, Florida, a star-like object the size of a disc was observed moving between clouds for 3 seconds.
interesting points: The duration of the observation was only 3 seconds, indicating a brief sighting.
The conclusion of the observation was that it was probably a balloon, based on the movement between clouds.
There was no photograph present in the report, so the description relied solely on the witness's account.
The report mentioned unusual sizes, movement, and colors of the saucer craft, and its disappearance to the west.
An intelligence officer noted the sighting of a Russian satellite in the vicinity around the same time, adding a layer of complexity to the observation.
sighted object: star-like object the size of a disc moving between clouds
